sub_title: Trainer, consultant and moderator with extensive international experience in helping individuals and organizations reach their full potential
summary:
I am an economist, MBA, PhD (Thesis - Improving the competitiveness of SMEs in transition countries), an experienced professional in the field of SMEs, entrepreneurship, regional development and smart specialization, author, founder of UMF Training, a training and consulting company that helps organizations and individuals grow, improve their performance and reaching their full potential. Being involved in development work for more than 25 years, I’ve been mainly focused on capacity building, organizational development and facilitating strategic processes. 
My international career includes moderating conferences, providing consulting services and designing and delivering trainings and presentations, for private companies, public institutions and non-governmental organizations in Albania, Armenia, Azerbaijan, BiH, Bulgaria, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Croatia, Jordan, Kyrgyzstan, Kosovo, Moldova, Montenegro, Serbia and USA.
I do not consider enrolling the university when I was 16, which makes me the youngest student in my country, or delivering training workshops for over 10,000 people from around 20 countries, as my biggest professional achievements. I am especially proud of little things that don't usually make it onto a resume:
1.	Investing all the money I earned from my own business at the age of 23 in post-graduation studies;
2.	Never losing faith, in spite of countless failures and mistakes (e.g. I passed the driver’s license exam after the eleventh attempt);
3.	After finding myself in a fight between two thugs and feeling a cold fork on my neck, managing to reconcile them and make them continue their quarrel at the bar, each of them insisting to pay the bill😊;
4.	Being disciplined and sticking to my diet for two weeks in a five-star hotel with the most delicious, exotic food😊
According to Gallup's study on the State of the Global Workplace in 142 countries, only 13% of employees worldwide are engaged at work. In other words, only about one in eight workers are psychologically committed to their jobs and unhappy employees create unhappy organizations uncapable of using their potential fully.
Other studies demonstrate that stakeholder engagement and effective communication are key factors in the success or failure of a project.
This is my “why”, my reasons why I have committed myself in both, organizational development through personal growth and improving development processes through effective with stakeholders’ participation.
Want to contact me for your group events or training sessions for your employees or partners? Email akaraev@t.mk
